settingsPane.description: The following settings are for all global CPU configuration, use it only if you know what you are doing.
settingsPane.name: CPU Global Settings

seekBar.description: Maximum Normal CPU-Speed. CPU Frequency steps by 50.000 kHz from 100.000 kMz to 1.200.000 kHz! if you want to use OC speeds set here 1.2Ghz! and tune the OC bar! if here speed is lower than MAX '1.2Ghz', OC bar is ignored! (Default: 1.200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Max Normal Frequency

seekBar.description: Overclock CPU Speed. To use OC you must set the Normal CPU speed to MAX '1.2Ghz' or this setting ignored! CPU Frequency steps by 100.000 kHz from 1.200.000 kMz to 1.600.000 kHz! ALERT! 1.5 GHz and 1.6 GHz can be unstable for your personal device! Try it and if the phone stuck (SOD), then your CPU will not work on such high frequency and you have to use a lower value! 1.6 Ghz is unstable on 85% of devices, try on your own risk (Default: 1.200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Max OC Frequency

seekBar.description: Minimum CPU-Speed. CPU Frequency step by 50000KHz are valid from 100.000 kHz to 1.200.000 kHz! (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Min Frequency

seekBar.description: When you touch the screen, CPU freq will jump UP to set value and go DOWN if no more to do, if CPU freq already above the value, then no change. (Default: 500.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Max Touch Frequency

seekBar.description: Minimum Frequency until second core will not be turned on, regardless of thresholds. (Default: 600.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: Min Frequency for 2-core

spinner.description: This sets the smooth scaling level which prevents Ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency, with load spikes. This setting will only change the behavior of Ondemand, HYPER, Sleepy, Scary and PegasusQ, Nightmare governors (default is Disabled, let gov to do the calculation).
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

seekBar.description: The second core will be enabled when the load goes above this threshold. If threshold is set above 24, and you have 800MHz as MAX, second core will not turn ON! If you set MAX CPU frequency lower than 800MHz, second core will be DISABLED! (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: load_h0

seekBar.description: Second core will be disabled when the load goes below this threshold. (Default: 20)
seekBar.name: load_l1

seekBar.description: Default: 2
seekBar.name: min_rq

seekBar.description: Default: 20
seekBar.name: load_rq

seekBar.description: Sets hot plug sampling intervals for screen-on state. (Default: 100)
seekBar.name: rate

settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness, so NOT checked is GOOD.
checkbox.name: GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE FAIR SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH POWER enables the use of ARM topology power functions instead of generic ones, and saves battery. Not recommended to disable.
checkbox.name: ARCH POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH POWER

settingsPane.description: Here you can set all the settings for power save!
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. For best stability use Idle + LPA. (Default: AFTR + LPA)
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode (Sleep Mode). For best stability use Idle + LPA. (Default: AFTR only)
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode (Sleep Mode)

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load. It sets the the load threshold on which BUS frequency will rise. (Default: 80%)
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

seekBar.description: Maximum DEEP SLEEP CPU speed. Default is Linux Kernel default value: 600000kHz. Samsung's default value is 800000kHz. Setting this too low will stuck your device!
seekBar.name: scaling_max_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum DEEP SLEEP CPU speed. (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum STANDBY (music playing and screen off) CPU speed. If music still shutter, rise frequency to 300000kHz/400000kHz. (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_standby_freq

seekBar.description: For developer debug only! You can add small delay to cortex wakeup/sleep script. This will delay all function changes and the wakeup! (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: Cortex Wakeup Delay

seekBar.description: Here you can change Cortex Wakeup Boost. It will give you full CPU power but only for the set time. After that time, all is set back to normal.
seekBar.name: Cortex Wakeup Boost

settingsPane.description: CPU Voltage Controls. Frequencies above 1200MHz are not allowed to be modified via STweaks. Voltage Range is 850~1350mV. Lower/higher is NOT SUPPORTED. All is done to prevent BUGS and SODS. USE this interface AT YOUR OWN RISK! If you get SOD before you can load this interface and can't fix your error, reset profiles from recovery. And think harder before you SOD your CPU with too much UV!
settingsPane.name: CPU Voltage Controls

checkbox.description: Main switch for Voltage Control! If disabled, all below settings have no effect! If you are using an external application or script to configure CPU voltage, don't tick this checkbox. Don't start to mod voltage before you enable this switch! It will not make any effect and you will have to set all to default, and tune again!
checkbox.name: CPU Voltage Main Switch
checkbox.label: CPU Voltage Main Switch

button.description: Use this button to see what CPU Voltage is used right now!
button.name: Check Active CPU Voltage
button.label: Check CPU Voltage

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1600 MHz. (Default: 1450 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1600 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1500 MHz. (Default: 1400 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1500 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1400 MHz. (Default: 1375 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1400 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1300 MHz. (Default: 1350 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1300 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1200 MHz. (Default: 1275 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1200 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1152 MHz. (Default: 1250 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1152 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1100 MHz. (Default: 1225 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1100 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1052 MHz. (Default: 1200 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1052 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 1000 MHz. (Default: 1175 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 1000 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 952 MHz. (Default: 1150 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 952 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 900 MHz. (Default: 1125 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 900 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 852 MHz. (Default: 1100 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 852 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 800 MHz. (Default: 1075 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 800 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 750 MHz. (Default: 1050 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 750 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 700 MHz. (Default: 1025 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 700MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 650 MHz. (Default: 1025 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 650 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 600 MHz. (Default: 1025 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 600 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 550 MHz. (Default: 1000 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 550 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 500 MHz. (Default: 1000 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 500 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 450 MHz. (Default: 975 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 450 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 400 MHz. (Default: 975 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 400 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 350 MHz. (Default: 975 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 350 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 300 MHz. (Default: 975 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 300 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 250 MHz. (Default: 950 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 250 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 200 MHz. (Default: 950 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 200 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 150 MHz. (Default: 925 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 150 MHz

seekBar.description: CPU Voltage for 100 MHz. (Default: 925 mV)
seekBar.name: CPU Voltage 100 MHz

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage advanced governor settings. If cortexbrain 'background-process' and 'CPU' are enabled. These settings are only active if the screen is on.
settingsPane.name: Governor Parameters tuning

spinner.description: This will set the AWAKE (screen ON) CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution), and can be overridden by any other scripts or applications.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

button.description: Use this button to push all new changes to GOV core in real time! the sleep tuning will be auto added on screen off, to screen off gov.
button.name: GOV Policy Install
button.label: Push CPU Tuning To GOV Core

settingsPane.description: Global Govs Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: GLOBAL GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy) (default is 75)
seekBar.name: up_threshold

seekBar.description: Measured in uS and actual meaning being Sampling Interval, this factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for HYPER, OnDemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy) (default is 60000)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold*current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step * policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservartive, Nightmare, Scary, Sleepy) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or inc_cpu_load. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Nightmare, Conservative, Scary) (default is 30)
seekBar.name: freq_step

seekBar.description: After spending sampling_down_factor*sampling_rate micro seconds at maximum frequency on high load, governor samples the load again to calculate an approx target frequency to scale-down-to which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sample. (Triggering up threshold may cause jumping to max frequency again). Max_load_freq is checked against (up_threshold - down_differential) * current frequency. If found to be smaller, CPU is scaled down to a target frequency as described above. Down_differential also act as the factor to prevent aggressive scale down. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Sleepy) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: down_differential

seekBar.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for HYPER, PegasusQ, Nightmare) (default is 400000)
seekBar.name: freq_for_responsiveness

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Load >= inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled up. (Only for lulzActiveQ, Nightmare) (default is 70)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Load less than inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled down. (Only for lulzActiveQ, Nightmare) (default is 50)
seekBar.name: dec_cpu_load

seekBar.description: No of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Up. After cpu_up_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Up logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Up, cpu_up_rate*up_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for lulzActiveQ, PegasusQ) (default is 10)
seekBar.name: cpu_up_rate

seekBar.description: No of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Down. After CPU_down_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Down logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Down, cpu_down_rate*down_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for lulzActiveQ, PegasusQ) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: cpu_down_rate

seekBar.description: This is same as the 'up_threshold' found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 30 it means that if the CPU usage needs to be below 30% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative, Scary) (default is 30)
seekBar.name: down_threshold

settingsPane.description: Nightmare Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: NIGHTMARE GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). (Only for Nightmare) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_up_factor

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is offline, If frequency of 1st core is >= freq_cpu1on and load average is >= trans_load_h0 2nd core will turn on. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 1000000)
seekBar.name: freq_cpu1on

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, If frequency of 1st core is less than freq_cpu1off and load average is less than trans_load_l1, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 700000)
seekBar.name: freq_cpu1off

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 15)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load >= inc_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 15)
seekBar.name: freq_up_brake

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal inc_cpu_load is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq and freq_up_brake. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 60)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is offline, If frequency of 1st core is >= freq_cpu1on and load average is >= trans_load_h0 2nd core will turn on. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: trans_load_h0

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, If frequency of 1st core is less than freq_cpu1off and load average is less than trans_load_l1, 2nd core will turn off. (default is 20)
seekBar.name: trans_load_l1

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, if rq_min less than trans_rq and its load is less than trans_load_rq, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: trans_load_rq

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, if rq_min less than trans_rq and its load is less than trans_load_rq, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 2)
seekBar.name: trans_rq

settingsPane.description: Pegasusq Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: PEGASUSQ GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal up_threshold is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between up_threshold_at_min_freq and down_differential. (Only for PegasusQ) (default is 40)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_at_min_freq

settingsPane.description: LulzActiveQ Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: LULZACTIVEQ GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Sampling time to scale cpu up. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 40000)
seekBar.name: up_sample_time

seekBar.description: Sampling time to scale cpu down. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 20000)
seekBar.name: down_sample_time

seekBar.description: No of scale up steps when load >= inc_cpu_load. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 2)
seekBar.name: pump_up_step

seekBar.description: No of scale down steps when load less than dec_cpu_load. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: pump_down_step

seekBar.description: Steps in frequency table to be used when screen-off. Example: If available freqs are 1600 1400 1200 1000 800 500 200 100 (L0 to L7) and screen_off_min_step=5 then 100,200 and 500 (L5 to L7) will be used during screen-off depending on the demand. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 11)
seekBar.name: screen_off_min_step

seekBar.description: lulzActiveQ: Input boost will automatically jump the phone to the hispeed_freq when you touch the screen to help prevent lag. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 1200000)
seekBar.name: hispeed_freq

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage advanced governor settings. If cortexbrain 'background-process' and 'CPU' are enabled. These settings are only active if the screen is off.
settingsPane.name: Governor Parameters tuning

spinner.description: This will set the DEEP SLEEP (screen off) CPU governor. Depends on cortex background process to be enabled.
spinner.name: Deep-Sleep! CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: Global Govs Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: GLOBAL GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Measured as percentage, when load on CPU is equal to above up threshold, CPU is scaled Up. Lower value - early scale up, and vice-verse. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy) (default is 75)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_sleep

seekBar.description: Measured in uS and actual meaning being Sampling Interval, this factor determines how often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make scaling decisions - either scale CPU Up or scale it Down. (Only for HYPER, OnDemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservative, Scary, Sleepy) (default is 70000)
seekBar.name: sampling_rate_sleep

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). Setting to 1 makes no difference and causes CPU to immediately scale down from highest frequency. Sampling down factor is NOT valid for lower frequencies and low load conditions. Note that CPU is scaled up to max frequency when max_load_freq is greater than up_threshold*current frequency. (or to cur_freq + (freq_step * policy.max_freq) whichever is smaller) Max_load_freq is an arbitrary frequency calculated as the maximum of load_frequencies. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Conservartive, Nightmare, Scary, Sleepy) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_down_factor_sleep

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should increase CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches up_threshold or inc_cpu_load. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, PegasusQ, Nightmare, Conservative, Scary) (default is 30)
seekBar.name: freq_step_sleep

seekBar.description: After spending sampling_down_factor*sampling_rate micro seconds at maximum frequency on high load, governor samples the load again to calculate an approx target frequency to scale-down-to which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sample. (Triggering up threshold may cause jumping to max frequency again). Max_load_freq is checked against (up_threshold - down_differential) * current frequency. If found to be smaller, CPU is scaled down to a target frequency as described above. Down_differential also act as the factor to prevent aggressive scale down. (Only for HYPER, Ondemand, Intellimand, PegasusQ, Sleepy) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: down_differential_sleep

seekBar.description: Until freq_for_responsiveness, Up Threshold considered for sampling load is up_threshold_at_min_freq. Also during the part where CPU is at maximum load frequency, governor need to find the optimal frequency as the next frequency - which should not trigger up_threshold in the next sampling. When such a frequency_next is found to be a) less than freq_for_responsiveness b) will not trigger down_threshold in the next sample, then the optimal frequency is set to freq_for_responsiveness. (Only for HYPER, PegasusQ, Nightmare) (default is 200000)
seekBar.name: freq_for_responsiveness_sleep

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU up. Load >= inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled up. (Only for lulzActiveQ, Nightmare) (default is 80)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_sleep

seekBar.description: The frequency at which governor scales CPU down. Load less than inc_cpu_load: cpu scaled down. (Only for lulzActiveQ, Nightmare) (default is 70)
seekBar.name: dec_cpu_load_sleep

seekBar.description: No of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Up. After cpu_up_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Up logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Up, cpu_up_rate*up_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for lulzActiveQ, PegasusQ) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: cpu_up_rate_sleep

seekBar.description: No of samples to evaluate load to scale CPU Down. After CPU_down_rate samples are finished for a frequency, CPU scale-Down logic is executed. In other words - before scaling Down, cpu_down_rate*down_sample_time micro seconds are spend at a frequency. (Only for lulzActiveQ, PegasusQ) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: cpu_down_rate_sleep

seekBar.description: This is same as the 'up_threshold' found for the Ondemand governor but for the opposite direction. For example when set to its default value of 30 it means that if the CPU usage needs to be below 30% between samples to have the frequency decreased. (Only for Conservative, Scary) (default is 30)
seekBar.name: down_threshold_sleep

settingsPane.description: Nightmare Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: NIGHTMARE GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Acts as a multiplier for sampling interval for re-evaluating the load when CPU is truly busy and is on highest clock frequency (policy max). (Only for Nightmare) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: sampling_up_factor_sleep

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is offline, If frequency of 1st core is >= freq_cpu1on_sleep and load average is >= trans_load_h0_scroff 2nd core will turn on. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 600000)
seekBar.name: freq_cpu1on_sleep

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, If frequency of 1st core is less than freq_cpu1off_sleep and load average is less than trans_load_l1_scroff, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 500000)
seekBar.name: freq_cpu1off_sleep

seekBar.description: Defines how much as a percentage of maximum frequency, governor should decrease CPU frequency each time CPU load reaches dec_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 15)
seekBar.name: freq_step_dec_sleep

seekBar.description: Brake scale up frequency when load >= inc_cpu_load. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 15)

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal inc_cpu_load is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq and freq_up_brake. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 60)
seekBar.name: inc_cpu_load_at_min_freq_sleep

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is offline, If frequency of 1st core is >= freq_cpu1on_sleep and load average is >= trans_load_h0_scroff 2nd core will turn on. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: trans_load_h0_scroff

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, If frequency of 1st core is less than freq_cpu1off_sleep and load average is less than trans_load_l1_scroff, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 20)
seekBar.name: trans_load_l1_scroff

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, if rq_min less than trans_rq_sleep and its load is less than trans_load_rq_sleep, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 10)
seekBar.name: trans_load_rq_sleep

seekBar.description: When 2nd core is online, if rq_min less than trans_rq_sleep and its load is less than trans_load_rq_sleep, 2nd core will turn off. (Only for Nightmare) (default is 2)
seekBar.name: trans_rq_sleep

settingsPane.description: Pegasusq Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: PEGASUSQ GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: This threshold is used as up threshold while sampling at frequencies less than freq_for_responsiveness. Above that, normal up_threshold is used. This gives us an option to make scaling aggressive/relaxed until a frequency and normal for higher frequencies. Again, during calculation of optimal frequency which should not trigger up policy, down threshold to consider is difference between up_threshold_at_min_freq and down_differential. (Only for PegasusQ) (default is 70)
seekBar.name: up_threshold_at_min_freq_sleep

settingsPane.description: LulzActiveQ Gov Configuration, see descriptions
settingsPane.name: LULZACTIVEQ GOV CONFIGURATON

seekBar.description: Sampling time to scale cpu up. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 60000)
seekBar.name: up_sample_time_sleep

seekBar.description: Sampling time to scale cpu down. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 10000)
seekBar.name: down_sample_time_sleep

seekBar.description: No of scale up steps when load >= inc_cpu_load. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 1)
seekBar.name: pump_up_step_sleep

seekBar.description: No of scale down steps when load less than dec_cpu_load. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 3)
seekBar.name: pump_down_step_sleep

seekBar.description: Steps in frequency table to be used when screen-off. Example: If available freqs are 1600 1400 1200 1000 800 500 200 100 (L0 to L7) and screen_off_min_step=5 then 100,200 and 500 (L5 to L7) will be used during screen-off depending on the demand. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 11)
seekBar.name: screen_off_min_step_sleep

seekBar.description: lulzActiveQ: Input boost will automatically jump the phone to the hispeed_freq when you touch the screen to help prevent lag. (Only for lulzActiveQ) (default is 400000)
seekBar.name: hispeed_freq_sleep

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune I/O settings managed by Kernel
settingsPane.name: I/O Tuning

spinner.description: Maximum number of kilobytes to read-ahead for file systems on this block device. Maybe get better read-performance with higher value, but you will probably need to experiment and benchmark (e.g. with SD Tools-App) to find the best value for your sd-card / system and maybe you will have a higher overhead (less memory) with a higher value. Works only if 'I/O-Tweaks' tweak is enabled! (Default: 128)
spinner.name: kilobytes to read-ahead

spinner.description: This will set the default AWAKE I/O scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard. (Default: ZEN)
spinner.name: Default Awake I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the STANDBY/DEEPSLEEP I/O scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard. (Default: NOOP)
spinner.name: STANDBY/DEEPSLEEP I/O Scheduler

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune memory and OOM (low mem management) settings managed by Kernel.
settingsPane.name: Memory Tuning

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of 'low mem management' by kernel lowmemkiller function, more aggressive, then more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Tuning - screen on

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of 'low mem management' by kernel lowmemkiller function, more aggressive, then more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Tuning - screen off

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations, buffer is released on need to free RAM (default 20)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations, buffer is released on need to free RAM (default 20)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

button.description: Clean RAM Cache, this will release all cached and buffered RAM
button.name: CLEAN RAM CACHE
button.label: CLEAN RAM CACHE NOW

spinner.description: ZRAM Module settings. Here you can shut down ZRAM or add more compressed RAM for your system.
spinner.name: ZRAM Settings

spinner.description: If you have enabled swap, then the higher a number set here, the more the system will swap. (Default: 0)
spinner.name: swappiness

button.description: ZRAM state check
button.name: ZRAM STATS
button.label: ZRAM STATS

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'KSM-Control'. This merge some memory but need cpu-power ...
checkbox.name: KSM-Control
checkbox.label: KSM-Control

button.description: KSM state check
button.name: KSM STATS
button.label: KSM STATS

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency/voltage/steps/utilization settings. Defaults frequencies are 108, 160, 200, 267 and 267. Voltage defaults are 900mV, 950mV, 1000mV, 1000mV and 1000mV.
settingsPane.name: GPU Control

checkbox.description: Enabling VPLL mode may be unstable on some devices so do not complain if your device lags or crashes (SOD). If you don't use VPLL Mode, the following frequency steps will be unavailable: 330, 440, 520. VPLL is a new frqeuency range to give some users more GPU performance. USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
checkbox.name: VPLL Mode
checkbox.label: VPLL Mode

seekBar.description: Here you can change GPU utilization timeout calculation. Closer to 100 (1sec) and you'll get faster GPU response in steps jump on load, but more battery is drained. CM10 default: 250(2.5sec)
seekBar.name: GPU Utilization Timeout

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 1

spinner.description: Changes the second GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 2

spinner.description: Changes the third GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400 MHz needs 1100 mV ~ 1200 mV. Above 1200 mV you risk to burn your chip!
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 3

spinner.description: Changes the fourth GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400, 440, 520 MHz needs 1100 mV ~ 1200 mV. Above 1200 mV you risk to burn your chip!
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 4

spinner.description: Changes the fifth GPU frequency step. WARNING! 400, 440, 520 MHz needs 1100 mV ~ 1200 mV. Above 1200 mV you risk to burn your chip!
spinner.name: GPU Frequency Step 5

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 900, 950, 950, 1000 and 1050. WARNING! Voltage above 1200 mV can put your device to risk! Do not blame me if GPU chip burned.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level4

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level5

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from third to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fourth to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from fourth to fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fifth to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 5-DOWN

settingsPane.description: Brightness Curve settings. Modifies auto-brightness behavior.
settingsPane.name: Brightness Curve

seekBar.description: Sets touchscreen move sensitivity (vitalij value).
seekBar.name: TouchMove Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Setting min_bl higher will result in staying in the lowest brightness level for brighter conditions. (Default: 30)
seekBar.name: min_bl

seekBar.description: Minimum brightness level. (Default: 1)
seekBar.name: min_gamma

seekBar.description: Maximum brightness level. (Default and MAX: 23)
seekBar.name: max_gamma

checkbox.description: LCD Power Reduce for backlight. If you like brighter screen in cost of battery drain, then turn it off. (Default: On)
checkbox.name: LCD POWER
checkbox.label: LCD POWER REDUCE

settingsPane.description: Settings for screen color by user manual input
settingsPane.name: Screen color menu

button.description: Push to reset screen color to default
button.name: Reset color to default
button.label: Default Color

seekBar.description: Sets screen BLUE color scale. (Default: 127)
seekBar.name: Blue Color Scale

seekBar.description: Sets screen RED color scale. (Default: 127)
seekBar.name: Red Color Scale

checkbox.description: mDNIe sharpness tweaks from hardcore. Requires reboot to be effective.
checkbox.name: mDNIe sharpness tweaks by GM!
checkbox.label: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Other Settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

seekBar.description: User adjustable gamma shift. (Default: 0)
seekBar.name: Gamma shift

seekBar.description: FB earlysuspend delay to run CRT animation when you turn the screen off.
seekBar.name: FB early suspend delay

seekBar.description: Vibration force level. (Default: 75)
seekBar.name: Vibration force

checkbox.description: Slide2Wake By Fluxi@xda. When screen is turned off, swipe from the left side of the screen to the right side of the screen, and the screen will be turned on!
checkbox.name: Slide2Wake ON/OFF switch
checkbox.label: Slide2Wake Switch

checkbox.description: Enable inverting screen colors by quickly pressing Home button.
checkbox.name: mDNIe Negative Toggle
checkbox.label: mDNIe Negative Toggle

spinner.description: Negative Color. Screen effect settings. Fast clicking Home button for the number of times configured will activate MOD
spinner.name: Negative Screen Mod tuning.

settingsPane.description: Here you can control kernel screen gestures, set at /data/gesture_set.sh. More can be added by user. This tweak depends on cortex background service to be enabled
settingsPane.name: Gestures panel

checkbox.description: Here you can turn on/off kernel built in gestures! See OP for instructions/ask in forum.
checkbox.name: Gestures switch
checkbox.label: Gestures switch

button.description: Click to reset gestures to default, or update with new one from dev. Gesture file will be added to '/data/' only if it is missing.
button.name: Reset gestures
button.label: Reset Gestures

settingsPane.description: Touchscreen configuration on battery and on charge. !ALERT! Wrong settings will disable touch screen! You will have to reset profiles in recovery! Also, settings for battery and charger are different! Do not set the same levels! Have fun tuning.
settingsPane.name: Touch screen sensitivity

seekBar.description: Touchscreen on BATTERY (Touch Threshold) (Default: 50)
seekBar.name: BATT Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: Touchscreen on BATTERY (Noise Threshold) (Default: 40)
seekBar.name: BATT Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: Touchscreen on BATTERY (Move Filter) (Default: 12)
seekBar.name: BATT Move Filter

seekBar.description: Touchscreen on CHARGER/USB (Touch Threshold) (Default: 53)
seekBar.name: CHRG Touch Treshold

seekBar.description: Touchscreen on CHARGER/USB (Noise Threshold) (Default: 38)
seekBar.name: CHRG Noise Treshold

seekBar.description: Touchscreen on CHARGER/USB (Move Filter) (Default: 47)
seekBar.name: CHRG Move Filter

settingsPane.description: JB ROM low sound bug fix on boot
settingsPane.name: LOW SOUND FIX

checkbox.description: Dirty Hack for JB ROM low Sound after boot. This patch will push the Vol DOWN and Vol UP for you on boot, and fix the low sound/ring every boot. You will see the volume slider moving! That is how it's fixed. Also it will reset the silence state if it's was set before boot. If you have an ICS ROM, just ignore this, it will not be used, ICS ROMs don't have the bug. Fix is OFF by default, if you set ON, effect will be on boot only.
checkbox.name: JB low sound fix on boot
checkbox.label: JB low sound fix on boot

settingsPane.description: Master headphone gain (amplification) settings, thanks to Gokhanmoral!
settingsPane.name: Headphone Amplification

spinner.description: Headphone amplifier level (0-3 which corresponds to 0dB, 1.5dB, 3dB, 6dB)
spinner.name: Headphone Amplifier

settingsPane.description: More headphone amplification + speaker amplification + Mic gain
settingsPane.name: Volume Levels and Gain Control

seekBar.description: Headphone amplification level
seekBar.name: Analog headphone level

seekBar.description: Headphone gain power level
seekBar.name: Analog headphone gain

seekBar.description: Analog Mic gain level
seekBar.name: Mic gain Level

seekBar.description: Analog speaker level
seekBar.name: Speaker level

settingsPane.description: BackLightNotification and Touch Keys related Settings
settingsPane.name: BackLightNotification

spinner.description: This setting will set led behavior for BLN.
spinner.name: BLN Effect

spinner.description: Notification timeout
spinner.name: notification_timeout

settingsPane.description: Touch keys light settings. Here you can set the way touch keys light work.
settingsPane.name: Touch keys lights settings

spinner.description: Led timeout. Select 'Use ROM defaults' if your ROM already has led timeout support (requires restart). You will need to use this setting on Samsung ROMs if you want to use led fadeout effect.
spinner.name: led_timeout

checkbox.description: BLN Without Wakelock. You cannot use blinking or breathing effects together with this option. Enabling this will let the CPU sleep during BLN and save battery.
checkbox.name: BLNWW
checkbox.label: BLNWW

checkbox.description: Led fadeout effect. If you are on a Samsung ROM, you need to set Touch Keys leds to always on or always off and use led timeout in STweaks.
checkbox.name: Led fadeout
checkbox.label: Led fadeout

checkbox.description: Selecting this will activate turning touckey leds on when you touch the screen (only when led timeout is enabled).
checkbox.name: Leds on with touch
checkbox.label: led-on-touch

button.description: Use this button to test BLN. BLN will be active after you turn the screen off.
button.name: Test BLN
button.label: Test BLN

seekBar.description: Controls touchpad led voltage level. (Default: 3000)
seekBar.name: Led voltage level

checkbox.description: Automatic touchpad led voltage level. If this one is checked, touchpad led voltage level will be ignored.
checkbox.name: Auto led voltage
checkbox.label: Auto Led Voltage

settingsPane.description: Here you can restore Home Key configuration before installing any other JB Sammy Kernel, you must push this button or Home Key will not work with other kernel.
settingsPane.name: Home Key Restore to JB Sammy default

button.description: Before installing any other JB SAMMY 'LEAK' kernel, use this to restore Home Key, if you will reboot again with my kernel, you will have to push button again, to restore the key before installing different JB SAMMY kernel, if you stay with my kernel, ignore this button!
button.name: Restore home key for other kernels
button.label: Restore Home Key NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate some script, which will automatically run in the background, at a specified time.
settingsPane.name: cron

spinner.description: Main switch for Cron Tasker. If you set this to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if this 'Cron Task service' is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON, and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting Cron. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET the scripts and jobs from kernel, to refresh the configuration. This will clear all your custom changes!
button.name: CRON RESET
button.label: RESET CRON

checkbox.description: Cron to clear file-cache every hour, but only if CPU is resting (IDLE) and more than 50% of your memory is used! This will free RAM from unused buffers and cache.
checkbox.name: Clean file-cache
checkbox.label: RAM cache clean every Hour

checkbox.description: Cron to update AD-BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. The script will check, if you are connected with the internet, otherwise it will try to use WIFI! Script will turn wifi, wait for connection and update, then when it's finished it will turn WIFI off. If there's no connection, an error will be written in the log.
checkbox.name: Update AD-Block
checkbox.label: Update AD-BLOCKER every week

checkbox.description: Cron to DB Optimize every day at 3:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: DB Optimization
checkbox.label: DB Optimization task every day at 3:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to clear app-cache every day at 4:00AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)!
checkbox.name: Clean app-cache
checkbox.label: Disk Clean task every day at 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron to fix app-permissions every day at 4:40AM, only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, and applications FC.
checkbox.name: Fix app-permissions
checkbox.label: Permissions fix every day at 4:40AM

checkbox.description: Cron to zipalign app's every day at 4:50AM, only if CPU is resting (IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, applications FC, and improve applications load speed. WARNING! Bakcup all apps before use! This process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing! USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK and update the broken applications!
checkbox.name: Zipalign Task
checkbox.label: Zipalign Task Every 4:50AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Here you can find some settings/options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Push to Reinstall/Update STweaks app. Here you can Reinstall/Update your STweak app to one that's added in the kernel. It will be installed to /system and if you had STweaks in /data, it will be removed. Application will close and you'll have it back from kernel in 5sec.
button.name: STweaks Reinstall/Update
button.label: STweaks Reinstall/Update

button.description: Click here to start fixing. Here you can run Fix Permissions, please click one time only, scripts will finish in max 2~3min, no reboot is needed.
button.name: FIX PERMISSIONS
button.label: FIX PERMISSIONS

button.description: Click here to start Zipaligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive, it's OK, do not use phone for 2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all user applications before use! This process will remove applications that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK, and update the broken applications!.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2min.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

spinner.description: WIFI supplicant scan interval. Here you can set the time in sec for WIFI to look for access points when ON. Higher the range, less battery used by WIFI! If you want WIFI to be forced OFF on screen OFF, Turn Force WIFI OFF Tweak in Cortex TAB, also if cortex process is ON, then it will be set automatically to 360sec on Screen OFF, so set your range for screen ON!
spinner.name: WIFI supplicant scan interval

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Here you can find GPS and NTP settings/options.
settingsPane.name: GPS - NTP

spinner.description: GPS-Time-Zone for faster GPS lock! Use your region!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

button.description: Update time via NTP server
button.name: UPDATE TIME
button.label: UPDATE TIME

settingsPane.description: USB and SDCARD settings/options.
settingsPane.name: USB - SDCARD

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or MTP.
spinner.name: USB mass storage mode

checkbox.description: If checked, Mass-Storage-SDCARDS will be auto-mounted when USB connected. then you can transfer files on high speed from PC to device. (Default: On)
checkbox.name: Auto Mount USB Drives
checkbox.label: Auto Mount USB Drives

button.description: Dual Mount-SDCARD and MMC via USB. After USB is disconnected, Dual Mount is disabled! This tweak is working automatically. Plug USB, turn off the screen and then turn ON, and you get working mounts. To scan your new MEDIA files, use some app to force Media Scan.
button.name: DUAL MOUNT
button.label: Dual Mount

settingsPane.description: Charger/Battery settings/options.
settingsPane.name: Battery

seekBar.description: Battery AC Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery AC Charge Current

seekBar.description: Battery MISC Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery MISC Charge Current

seekBar.description: Battery USB Charge Current Setting
seekBar.name: Battery USB Charge Current

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge chip is behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for that period, then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge Chip

checkbox.description: If checked, BetterBatteryStatus will report discrete (non-overlapping) wake lock statistics.
checkbox.name: Discrete Wake lock Stats
checkbox.label: Discrete Wake lock Stats

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add/Update/Remove AD Blocker! You need ROOT to do the tweak! If you want to update the blocker, you can push the "UPDATE AD NOW" button, to get the new one installed! If you install a new ROM, and you want to use AD BLOCKER, then push "UPDATE AD NOW" and REBOOT. If you need to REMOVE AD-BLOCKER use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker

button.description: ADD/UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE/ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable INIT.D scripts RUN on boot. Many new ROMS are running the init.d scripts automatically. You can also force running the scripts, but if you run them and ROM runs them too, we have a problem: all scripts are running X2 times! To avoid conflicts, Stweaks RUN-control is disabled by default. If you know that your ROM is NOT supporting init.d script running, then turn it ON here and reboot.
checkbox.name: INIT.D Scripts RUN control
checkbox.label: Enable INIT.D scripts RUN-control

settingsPane.description: Android Additional Logs
settingsPane.name: Logger

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Additional Logs (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

settingsPane.description: Fixes file system only if needed!
settingsPane.name: FS

button.description: DATA and CACHE file system check and repair on boot. !WARNING! This is a VERY DANGEROUS option! Before activating it DO A FULL BACKUP with Titanium Backup or any kind of backup application! If you have lots of damage in your DATA partition, after fix and repair, ROM may NOT BOOT anymore! In that case reinstall ROM, and if you still can't boot, you will have to format DATA file system via recovery! USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! THIS FUNCTION IS NOT A TOY! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! This function works only for main ROM, second ROM gets no effect and by default it's OFF. It's also one time action, push the button to Activate, push again to Abort!
button.name: FIX File System on BOOT
button.label: FIX DATA ON/OFF

button.description: Clean the media cache on your sdcard. Push once to clean, push again to abort. You have to reboot for action to work!
button.name: Clean media-cache
button.label: FIX MEDIA ON/OFF

settingsPane.description: Remove OR Reinstall ROOT! You can have a ROOTED or not ROOTED phone.
settingsPane.name: Root

button.description: Root Install. Click to install ROOT (SuperUser) + ROM Busybox if existed. In case you have used the remove button, to Reinstall ROOT first REMOVE it! This function depends on CORTEX process to be enabled!
button.name: ROOT INSTALL
button.label: INSTALL ROOT

button.description: Root Remove/Uninstall. Click to remove Any ROOT installed + Busybox (kernel's Busybox remains, but is hidden from system) To install ROOT check the Auto-Install Root and REBOOT.
button.name: ROOT REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE ROOT

button.description: Root check. Click to see if you have ROOT or not
button.name: ROOT Check
button.label: ROOT CHECK

checkbox.description: If box is checked, root will be installed on the next restart.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: This script will manipulate many kernel settings, based on chosen STweaks profile + settings and on screen state (ON/OFF) and we call it 'CortexBrain'. To reset the kernel-settings, after you disable a tweak, you must reboot!
settingsPane.name: CortexBrain Tweaks

spinner.description: Enable or Disable the 'background-process' from 'CortexBrain'. If you disable it, you will lose the function that set different settings for screen state (ON/OFF).
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Click to see if the 'CortexBrain-Background-Process' is running or not.
button.name: Check Background-Process
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

spinner.description: Here you can control android logger 'logcat'. If you set it to AUTO, then you will have logs only on screen is on. When screen will be off, logger will be disabled to save battery. If you set DEBUG, it will be working no matter what! If set to DISABLED, logging will be off, no matter what. If USB/Charger is connected and logger is set to AUTO, logging will not be disabled so we can debug. Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process to be enabled! (dynamic by cortex).
spinner.name: Android Logger control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable the 'Wifi turns off while screen is off' function. Depends on CortexBrain-Background-Process to be enabled! (dynamic by cortex).
checkbox.name: Auto-Wifi
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Wifi

seekBar.description: Here you can set a delay before WIFI is forced to OFF when screen is turned off. Works only if 'Auto-Wifi' is Enabled! (dynamic by cortex).
seekBar.name: WIFI Turn Off Delay (in sec)

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'ICMP only Firewall-Tweaks' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'TCP-Tweaks' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: TCP-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'IPv6 Network'. (dynamic by cortex).
checkbox.name: IPv6 Tweaks
checkbox.label: IPv6

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'CPU-Tweaks' (dynamic by cortex).
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'Memory-Tweaks' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'Battery-Tweaks' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Battery-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Battery-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'System-Tweak' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'Kernel-Tweaks' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable 'I/O-Tweaks' (reboot needed).
checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is used right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose some profiles. You can also switch the default profiles (battery, default, performance) via Kernel-Recovery.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup/restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup/Restore

button.description: Backup STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Backup
button.label: BACKUP NOW

button.description: Restore STweaks User Settings!
button.name: Settings Restore
button.label: RESTORE NOW

settingsPane.description: Dual-Boot Settings. WARNING! No confirmation will be asked for reboot buttons!
settingsPane.name: Dual-Boot Settings

button.description: Reboot into custom recovery which let you configure, clone or backup the 2nd ROM
button.name: Reboot into ROM Recovery
button.label: Reboot into recovery

button.description: Reboot into 1st ROM
button.name: Reboot into 1st ROM
button.label: Reboot into 1st ROM

button.description: Reboot into 2nd ROM
button.name: Reboot into 2nd ROM
button.label: Reboot into 2nd ROM

checkbox.description: Check this if you don't want boot logo to be shown. If this options is checked boot logo will not be shown even if you have 2ndROM installed.
checkbox.name: No boot-logo
checkbox.label: No boot-logo

spinner.description: Default ROM to boot into. If you don't have 2nd ROM installed, 1st ROM will be booted. If you press the home or volume-down buttons during the boot logo the alternative ROM will be booted, i.e. 1st ROM will be booted if the default ROM selection is the 2nd ROM.
spinner.name: Default ROM

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card (/sdcard) ...
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for Apps
button.name: App-Bug
button.label: APP-BUG

settingsPane.description: Check if there is a new kernel-update available.
settingsPane.name: Kernel-Update

button.description: Check for Update
button.name: Kernel-Update
button.label: KERNEL-CHECK
